text:
Often I want to essentially dispatch a function on whether its defined a method.  It seems both forbidden but also within reach.  Is there anyway to achieve the following without (naughty abuse of) generated functions and in a way which type-infers?

```using Test
struct MyTypeA end

struct Has end
struct NotHas end

dispatchfunc(f) = hasmethod(f, Tuple{MyTypeA}) ? Has() : NotHas()

a(x::MyTypeA) = 1
b(x::Int) = 1

@test dispatchfunc(a) == Has()
@test dispatchfunc(b) == NotHas()```
